Posts.Content: raregold12 wrote: Let me start by saying, I have been reading post today and this site seems awesome and full of support....Also, Im a little scared and waiting to hear back from my gyno....Here is my story...  I had my very first mammogram on Friday the 22nd of April.  I am 41 years young and my doctor did an exam back in Nov. and couldnt detect anything however felt it was best I get checked.  I got a letter in the mail yesterday stating that  the test shows the need for further evaluation of my right breast and they would like to set me up for an ultrasound.   At first I was scared because since the doctor found nothing I assumed all was ok.  I have talked to several women who all say more than likely it's nothing and some have even stressed to not go and do the ultrasound because of the money.  Money of course would not stop me, so Im just wanting some opinions as to what you all think....  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: First Mammogram raregold12 angelinac

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 04:06PM raregold12 wrote: I am going for the ultra sound on Tues.  I went and got my report, thanks JbinOk for suggesting that, my gyno also called me to talk to me, she told me she wants me to have the test more for precaution than anything because as the report reads, BI-RADS 0 Further assessment of possible dnsities which are near 4-5mm, times three and are probably benign structures.  Index of susupicion is low, however the mammography category is 0.    Will find out more Tues...so from what I have read, if there are cyst, I should ask for a biopsy even if advised to come back in 6 months?
Posts.Title: First Mammogram raregold12 angelinac

Posts.Content: May 5, 2011 08:17AM raregold12 wrote: Got my results....Category 3, Probably Benign and to have a followup Mammo in 6 months.....This is what I rec from the records department at the hospital, still waiting to get the letter from my doctor.  So, all looks well.
